security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation-only file containing YAML workflow templates and CLI command references. No executable code, scripts, or malicious patterns detected. The file describes external tools but does not contain any code that could execute malicious actions.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub Actions workflows with AI swarms
content.value_statement: Managing GitHub Actions workflows manually consumes significant developer time and introduces errors. This skill provides AI-powered swarm coordination to generate, optimize, and monitor CI/CD pipelines automatically. It handles workflow creation, parallel test execution, security scanning, and release management without manual intervention.
actual_capabilities: Generate optimized GitHub Actions workflows from code analysis
Coordinate multi-agent PR reviews with automated validation
Create self-healing pipelines that auto-diagnose and fix failures
Run intelligent parallel test selection and execution
Monitor workflow performance and suggest cost optimizations
Manage releases with semantic versioning and changelog generation
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) and Node.js v16+ to be installed
Depends on claude-flow@alpha package for swarm coordination
Cannot modify repository settings outside of workflow files
Does not provide native integration with non-GitHub CI systems

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Management
use_cases.description: Generate and optimize GitHub Actions workflows for continuous integration and deployment across projects of any size

use_cases.title: Automated PR Validation
use_cases.description: Run parallel linter, tester, security, and docs agents automatically on every pull request

use_cases.title: Automated Release Orchestration
use_cases.description: Coordinate multi-stage releases with semantic versioning, changelog generation, and deployment strategies

prompt_templates.title: Generate Basic CI Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that runs on push to main. Include steps for checking out code, installing dependencies, running linters, and executing tests. Output the YAML file to .github/workflows/ci.yml

prompt_templates.title: Optimize Existing Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the current .github/workflows/ci.yml workflow and suggest optimizations for parallel execution, caching strategies, and reduced build times. Show estimated time and cost savings.

prompt_templates.title: Create PR Validation Swarm
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow that validates pull requests by spawning parallel agents for linting, unit tests, security scanning, and documentation checks. Post results as a PR comment.

prompt_templates.title: Build Self-Healing Pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a self-healing GitHub Actions workflow that automatically diagnoses failed runs, identifies common failure patterns, and creates fix PRs with suggested changes.

output_examples.input: Generate a GitHub Actions workflow for a Node.js project with testing and deployment
output: Generated .github/workflows/node-ci.yml with 3 jobs: build, test, and deploy
Build job: installs dependencies, runs lint and build
Test job: executes test suite with coverage reporting
Deploy job: runs only on main branch with production secrets

best_practices: Use workflow dependencies (needs) to ensure proper job ordering and early failure detection
Implement caching for dependencies to reduce workflow execution time and costs
Set appropriate timeout-minutes on jobs and individual steps to prevent runaway workflows
anti_patterns: Running all tests sequentially without parallel execution increases build time significantly
Not using secrets management for sensitive values exposes credentials in workflow logs
Skipping workflow optimization leads to wasted compute time and higher costs

faq.question: What prerequisites are needed before installing this skill?
faq.answer: Install GitHub CLI (gh), configure authentication with gh auth login, ensure Node.js v16+ is available, and install claude-flow@alpha package.

faq.question: What are the resource limits for workflow execution?
faq.answer: GitHub-hosted runners provide 2 vCPUs and 7GB RAM for standard runners. Self-hosted runners can be configured with custom resources.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with existing GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: The skill generates YAML workflow files compatible with GitHub Actions. Existing workflows can be optimized or used as templates for new workflows.

faq.question: Is my repository data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: The skill operates within GitHub Actions permissions. Workflows run in isolated runners. No data is sent to external services beyond GitHub APIs.

faq.question: Why did my workflow fail to generate?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing .github/workflows directory, insufficient permissions, unauthenticated GitHub CLI, or unsupported Node.js version.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub's native workflow features?
faq.answer: This skill adds AI-powered coordination on top of native features. It handles multi-agent orchestration, predictive optimization, and automated fixes that native workflows do not provide.
